medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent diarrhea, vomiting, and weight loss.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 2.5 years before admission with abdominal cramping and nonbloody diarrhea developing 1 day post-flight to Colorado. Symptoms worsened over time, with episodes of diarrhea occurring hourly before admission and associated with nausea, vomiting, and anorexia, leading to significant weight loss of 15.9 kg.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of Barrett’s esophagus, gastric ulcer, and duodenal ulcers; previously treated for episodes of diarrhea with metronidazole and proton-pump inhibitors.
medical_history.family_history: Father has dementia; mother had a history of Parkinson’s disease and heart disease; an uncle had stomach cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Moderate alcohol consumption; smoked in young adulthood; no illicit drug use; monogamous relationship; lack of exposure to sick persons or animals.
